intro: Anchusa deflexa, commonly known as the bending blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in coastal areas. Anchusa deflexa has small, ovate leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
